= Maven users =

We don't have a maven repository yet but it's very easy to download the latest release sources and install the artifact in your local maven repository:

{{{
$ svn co http://spring-crypto-utils.googlecode.com/svn/tags/spring-crypto-utils-0.9.2
$ cd spring-crypto-utils-0.9.2
$ mvn clean install
}}}

Add the following dependency block to your pom:

{{{
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.google.code.spring-crypto-utils</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-crypto-utils</artifactId>
    <version>0.9.2</version>
</dependency>
}}}

= Non maven users =

Download the latest jar from the download page and put the file in the classpath of your application.

The following jars are also needed:

  * Apache Commons
    * [http://commons.apache.org/logging/ commons-logging:commons-logging:jar:1.1.1]
    * [http://commons.apache.org/codec/ commons-codec:commons-codec:jar:1.4]
  * [http://www.springsource.org/download Spring]
    * org.springframework:spring-context:jar:3.0.2.RELEASE
    * org.springframework:spring-beans:jar:3.0.2.RELEASE
    * org.springframework:spring-core:jar:3.0.2.RELEASE
    * org.springframework:spring-expression:jar:3.0.2.RELEASE
    * org.springframework:spring-asm:jar:3.0.2.RELEASE

= Spring Version =

Although the project uses Spring 3, at this time there is nothing specific about Spring 3 in the code, so your should be able to replace the Spring jars with their 2.5 equivalents and everything should still work.
